Sensor Monitor is designed to monitor your Android device sensors.
This app detects all available sensors on your device, gives visual feedback of the sensor\'s values in real-time and allows you to save the acquired data into a file for post-processing.
To leave feedback to help improve this app, report bugs or even suggest new features, send a message to this e-mail:
I\'ll be happy to incorporate your suggestions in future releases.
To start monitoring a sensor\'s activity, select a sensor from the Main menu.
Android-powered devices have built-in sensors that can be divided into 3 categories.
Sensors
Motion sensors
Environmental sensors
Position sensors
Useful for monitoring movement, such as tilt, shake, rotation or swing.
Useful for determining the physical position in the world\'s frame of reference.
They monitor relative ambient humidity, illuminance, ambient pressure and temperature.
If a sensor is disabled, your device doesn\'t support it.
To view sensor\'s capabilities and description, click the info button.
To begin acquiring and visualizing sensor data, click Play.
To pause acquisition, click Pause. To continue, click Play again.
To clear all data, click Reset. All unsaved data will be lost.
To save the sensor data into a file, click Save. You\'ll be notified of the file location.

An acceleration sensor measures the acceleration force applied to the device in m/s², including the force of gravity.
It uses a standard 3-axis coordinate system (x, y, z) to express data values.
The accelerometer is a good sensor to use if you are monitoring device motion.
The gravity sensor measures the acceleration force applied to the device in m/s².
It provides a three dimensional vector (x, y, z) indicating the direction and magnitude of gravity.
Common uses include motion detection like shake or tilt.
The gyroscope measures the rate or rotation in rad/s around a device\'s x, y, and z axis.

Rotation is positive in the counter-clockwise direction; that is, an observer looking from some positive location on the x, y or z axis at a device positioned on the origin would report positive rotation if the device appeared to be rotating counter clockwise.
Can be used for rotation detection (spin, turn, etc.)
Measures the relative ambient humidity in percent (%).
This sensor is hardware-based and is available only if a device manufacturer has built them into a device.
Measures the ambient light level (illumination) in lx.
Most device manufacturers use this sensor to control screen brightness.
The linear acceleration sensor provides you with a three-dimensional vector representing acceleration along each device axis, excluding gravity.
The sensor coordinate system is the same as the one used by the acceleration sensor, as are the units of measure (m/s²).
You typically use this sensor when you want to obtain acceleration data without the influence of gravity. For example, you could use this sensor to see how fast your car is going.
The geomagnetic field sensor lets you monitor changes in the earth\'s magnetic field.
This sensor provides raw field strength data (in µT) for each of the three coordinate axes.
Common uses include the creation of a compass.
Measures the ambient air pressure in hPa.
This sensor is hardware-based and is available only if a device manufacturer has built them into a device.
Can be used to monitor air pressure changes.
The rotation vector represents the orientation of the device as a combination of an angle and an axis, in which the device has rotated through an angle θ around an axis (x, y, or z).

The three elements of the rotation vector are equal to the last three components of a unit quaternion (cos(Θ/2), x*sin(Θ/2), y*sin(Θ/2), z*sin(Θ/2)). Elements of the rotation vector are unitless. The reference coordinate system is defined as a direct orthonormal basis.
Common uses are motion detection and rotation detection.
Measures the ambient room temperature in degrees Celsius (°C). It returns a single sensor value for each data event.
This sensor is hardware-based and is available only if a device manufacturer has built them into a device.
Can be used for monitoring air temperatures.
